revised_title: Vomito Prieto: A Distemper Affecting Europeans in the Tropics
tldr: The author discusses the Vomito Prieto, a dangerous disease affecting Europeans in tropical climates, particularly in the city of Cartagena in South America. The disease is more prevalent among sailors and those with limited access to better living conditions. The author suggests that the disease may be related to the harsh climate, labor, and diet of those affected. Despite efforts to find a remedy, no effective treatment has been discovered.
scientific_discipline: Medicine and Health Sciences > Tropical Medicine
